intro: Zanthoxylum rhodoxylon subsp. rhodoxylon, commonly known as the red-berried prickly ash, is a member of the Rutaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, red berries that turn yellow as they mature. Its bark is thick and fissured, often exuding a resinous sap. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
